title: Dobrynya Nikitich (opera)
text:
Dobrynya Nikitich (Op. 22) is a 1901 <a href="opera">opera</a> by <a href="Aleksandr%20Grechaninov">Aleksandr Grechaninov</a>. It is described as a "Opera-Legend" based on the <a href="bogatyr">bogatyr</a> <a href="Dobrynya%20Nikitich">Dobrynya Nikitich</a>. The opera opened at the <a href="Bolshoy%20Theatre">Bolshoy Theatre</a> on October 14, 1903, with <a href="Fyodor%20Chaliapin">Fyodor Chaliapin</a> in the lead.
Recordings.
Excerpts were recorded by the Leningrad Radio Choir and Russian balalaika orchestra 'Vasiliy Andreev' under <a href="Georgy%20Doniyakh">Georgy Doniyakh</a> in 1959, with Viktor Morozov (bass) Matvej Gavrilkin (tenor) Aleksandra Meshcheryakova (mezzo-soprano) and Lyudmila Grudina (mezzo-soprano).
